label: Description
value: Valence shaped piece and three fragments, printed by plate with color added by block; design: "Toilet of Venus". A) Valence shows a canopy in red and blue, below which is part of scene of Venus and attendants. Other fragments show mill, landscape detail, part of temple. Probably Nantes.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton Technique: printed by engraved copper plate on plain weave; block printed on plain weave

label: Description
value: Two breadths of cotton joined in center. Black center area showing a fine red stripe running through. On either side is a wide border woven in yellow, black, and gold in a geometric (patola-inspired) design.

label: Physical description
value: Meidum: silk, cotton, metallic threads Technique: plain weave with continuous supplementary weft patterning

label: Description
value: Silk patola with tied resist pattern in purple and yellow showing vertical lines and central pattern of diamonds and stars with border of diamonds and hearts. Stripes run parallel to selvage on either side. Fringe at top and bottom.

label: Description
value: Fragment of a narrow border pattern. Red silk with design of lozenge shapes in flat silver foil strips.

label: Description
value: Square of woven textile  in dark purple wool and undyed linen. The design shows  a water-fowl within a circle and square. Border of quatrefoils, scrolls and  dots. The square has been mounted onto another piece of undyed woven linen.

value: Medium: wool, linen Technique: tapestry eave

value: Pre-1961: Alan L. Wolfe; 1961: acquired by the Museum.

label: Description
